name: Eastern-Style Mulligatawny Soup
author: Pantaloons
summary: This is the recipe from Shalimar Restaurant in Albany, NY. It is amazing. Enjoy this soup with some vegetable samosas and cheese naan bread. As with most soups, the longer you cook it, the more flavorful it is. Also, this soup is better when its a little thicker rather than watery.
ingredients: 4 cups water, or more as needed
½ teaspoon ground dried chile pepper
directions: Pour enough water over split peas in a large bowl to cover by at least 1 inch; soak at least 30 minutes
Drain split peas and transfer to a large pot
Pour 4 cups water over the split peas

Stir turmeric, ground dried chile pepper, and salt into the water; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, adding more water as needed to thin, until split peas are tender, 30 to 40 minutes
Stir lemon juice and tomato paste into the split pea mixture; increase heat to medium and cook until the mixture thickens, about 10 minutes more
Heat vegetable oil in a small saucepan over medium heat
Fry garlic and cumin seeds in hot oil until the garlic browns, about 5 minutes; stir into the soup
